p: The novel human coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) seems emerged in December 2019 in Wuhan, China ( 1, 2). Later, on January 12, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) named it the 2019 novel Coronavirus (nCoV) and announced as a pandemic outbreak. SARS-CoV-2 is a member of β -coronaviruses. It is genetically related to the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome—Human coronavirus (SARS-CoV) and the Middle-East Respiratory Syndrome—Human coronavirus MERS-CoV ( 3– 5).
